Coleman seconded and unanimous approval was given.
Schooley moved that the president of the NAEB in
consultation with the Chairman of the ETRC Affiliates
Committee appoint one NAEB community station member.
Bronson seconded and approval was unanimous.**
(ALthough the Minutes do not so state , it was under¬
stood that travel and living costs incurred in
connection with this meeting would be borne by NAEB.)
In view of these Board actions» I now am sending out this
notice to set the time of the meeting, and to start getting
an agenda together.
1, Personnel. Have I left out anybody from NAEB who
was intencteT'to^e covered by our action in St. Louis? Unless
there is a reply to that effect, I shall assume not.
2. Date. (We have assumed that the place would be
Chicago. )'“Attached is a calendar. Please' mark7 it up as
indicated, and I®11 set the time as soon as I have all the
returns. It*s unlikely there will be one time when all of
us can come. But I611 take the dates when most can be there.
Please let me hear from you by return mall."
3* Agenda. What proposals do you have for an "agenda**?
Should we start with a consideration of our Constitution? Of
our purposes and objectives? Of our relations with other
groups? Would you like to list individual items which could
then be made into an agenda whose adaption or change would be
the first order of business?
4. Advisers. What suggestions do you have for advisers
from within or without our ranks (in addition to the NAEB
participants listed at the head of this memorandum)? What
fields do you think should be represented—education, government,
educational administration, learned societies, foundations,
commercial broadcasting, what? (My listing of these groups
is not an indication that I believe we should invite advice
from all; it is done just to elicit comments!)
Let me hear from you by return mall if possible about the
date, and soon afterwards as to meeting procedures.
